posts.post_content:
Typically this would do at most 3 damage a turn. But there are plenty of ways to give your opponent cards before their upkeep so they get smacked with lots more. I'm not sure why Lord settled on 6 damage, however.
  
   
If I [Braingeyser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braingeyser) you with 2 or 3 of these out you can start shuffling for the next match.

Posted By: Ganryu (11/20/2009 11:20:58 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of the most memorial decks I used to play against in the pre-4th edition world used a set of these, [Underworld Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underworld Dreams) and [Brain Geyse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brain Geyse) to stomp your face.   
  
Imagine you're at 5 cards with two vices and an [Underworld Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underworld Dreams) targeting you. Your opponent hits you with a brain geyser for five on his turn, which means you take 5 from Dreams and then 12 during your upkeep...plus one on the draw, just for a bonus!  
  
Course...his play set of [Juzham Djinn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juzham Djinn)s didnt hurt as finishers!
posts.html:

Course...his play set of Juzham Djinns didnt hurt as finishers!
